website_summaries.verdict: A high-end Ethernet switch that works perfectly for streaming videos, playing music and other everyday applications.
pros: Equipped with GREENnet technology that limits the switch's power consumption without sacrificing performance
Metal construction guarantees the switch is built to last
Backed by a manufacturer's lifetime warranty
cons: Sometimes makes a high-pitch noise when in use
Less durable than many comparable options

customer_reviews.title: BAD PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Got this "switch" to be able to move my wireless router to a different area of the house while keeping my other devices next to the computer. Had issues with the network immediately and after replacing the router (due to thinking it was broken), and the modem(due to thinking it was not functioning), and spending the weekend troubleshooting issues found that the "Switch" was in fact a split that would only allow one device internet access at a time. After replacing the "switch" with my older wireless router the system worked perfectly... so thank you TrendNet for driving up my $60 router move to a $250 system upgrade..... wont be having this switch in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Tisha

customer_reviews.title: Low Latency
customer_reviews.text: I bought this switch so that I can get the two on my PC connected to my local network with only one cable coming from the Router. The switch is connected to the Router, which is 2 rooms away, and the two of my pcs are connected directly to this switch. I performed a simple ping test for you guys: The time my PC, connected to this switch, needs to contact the Router is around 3 ms. The time it takes for the two personal computers, both plugged into this switch, to communicate with one another is just 1ms. That being said, I genuinely recommend this switch.
customer_reviews.author: Marko Bogosavljevic

customer_reviews.title: elegant, solid, works
customer_reviews.text: This switch works as expected, is a nice, manageable shape and size, and feels sturdy. When I was opening it to take a look at the electronics inside, the opening of the case felt nice and smooth. Some people might be inconvenienced by the fact that the power cable plugs into the side, rather than into the back panel. Including a photo of the interior of the switch, showing a Realtek RTL8367N, transformers, a voltage regulator, and an EEPROM for configuration.
customer_reviews.author: John S. Glassmyer

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great for 3 Months
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like such a great deal but only worked for about 3 months. Bought in August, burned out or stopped working (no power light) in December. Thought I had a network problem but I had this tucked away in a cabinet. Bypassed it and all good now. I sure do NOT recommend this. Not worth trying to return; I ordered a NetGear 5 port to replace it. Guess you do get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Skip Stein

customer_reviews.title: Nice little guy to have behind the TV.
customer_reviews.text: I have this behind my TV where I have my game consoles and NAS/Steam streaming box. Two months uptime and no issues. I like to have all my devices hardwired when possible so this was nice to have so I only had to run one line to my stuff, then made my own 2-3 foot cables to each device on the TV stand.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Splits my Ethernet
customer_reviews.text: I thought that being a "5 port" ment one input and 5 outputs, but it is unmanaged so you just plug the input into one of the ports and it recognizes that and splits it out into the other 4... I only really needed one more at the time so it works for me but just keep in mind it is actually 1 in and 4 out. Other than that it works great, I haven't noticed any slower speeds or anything, I do only have 40 Mbps but it seems to be going at that speed
customer_reviews.author: Daniel McBride

customer_reviews.title: Best switch for home or business!
customer_reviews.text: Best switch in the business - for office or home! I’ve used many other brands from consumer to professional, and if you want a durable, easy install unit: this is it! Metal housing can take inadvertent office or home abuse. 4-way mounting points for omnidirectional install. I’ve been using these for 5yrs now, installing 5-6 units, and not one has let me down. Since I’ve had such good luck with these, I purchased their larger units as well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Yee

customer_reviews.title: Very nice switch, fast reliable small.
customer_reviews.text: I already had one of these in my network. Added a second. Full 1 gigabit network. Speed test shows no difference in speed with two of these inline or direct to router. Stays cool even though one has been in operation with a heavy load on and off for months. Very small footprint with network connection to rear making it good for desktop use. Solid metal housing. The only negative is when viewed at an angle, the LED for 1 port lights the neighboring port if the port is empty making it look like 2 ports are in use. This is a minor complaint and as I said only happens if not looking at unit head on.
customer_reviews.author: Karl G.Top Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Good product while it works
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what I needed it to do. Only had it in line with my network for a short time but my speeds are now reaching almost to the max that I should be receiving of nearly 1 gigabit down. Update: after about 5 months using this little guy it has given out. This may be better for slower connections and traffic. Unfortunately, doing many bandwidth hungry activities at once like heavy gaming, streaming, voice chat among other things, seems to have brought this to its knees.
customer_reviews.author: Elliott

customer_reviews.title: It works and can be placed on a desktop rather than hidden away
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the very few switches I could find that is designed to be put on your desk (in view), facing forward, with the jacks in the back. The other ones I saw were either designed to be hidden away, hung on a wall somewhere, or had the ethernet ports in the FRONT of the switch. None of those others made sense to me, which is why I bought this one. In the few weeks I've had it I haven't had any problems. The front/display of this switch is just little green lights indicating an active connection. Since I've plugged mine in it has just worked, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: One year warrenty (Such B.S.) regarless of what CUTE little badge stating LIFETIME warrenty.
customer_reviews.text: Lifetime Warranty only applies if it's 3 years or less! Bought in Aug 2013 ya it works for 5 years then shat itself, would not pass ARP's and DHCP/DNC info. Did basic trouble shooting and it was broke. Called TrendNet gave them the entire thing spent 25m repeating the trouble shooting steps with a nice Indian dude. Then yep it's broke - BUT - hey our Lifetime Warranty only applies if it's 3 years or less! So go buy a new, different, one - good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Stressless

customer_reviews.title: Nice cost friendly gig switch
customer_reviews.text: I have this switch currently mounted at a remote site that is not temperature controlled. Over the last few weeks it has seen high moisture and temps under 20 degrees Fahrenheit and this switch has not missed a beat. Now this is a temporary solution to a issue I have and I can not speak for how long it might run in such harsh conditions, but if it works here with no issues I would say it will do a great job in a house or small office install. It is weird how the power cord plugs into the side of the unit but that is not a deal breaker for me. Great switch for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Roger Olinger

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as advertised - at least not this one
customer_reviews.text: I have two other units, both work fine. They have been working great for a while, over a year each, with little problems. On one a port went, OK, not a big deal and the other is still working fine. For this new one - the unit works, but only at half-duplex for all ports. Changed the WAN feed from my other operational unit, no change, still only half-duplex. Would I buy another, perhaps, but may look at an alternate brand, at least to test the input.
customer_reviews.author: BJoel

customer_reviews.title: Compact sturdy reliable
customer_reviews.text: When I upgraded to 200megabit service for my internet, my 10/100 switches were now too slow. I purchased 3 of these switches and the upgrade was quick and painless. I simply swapped them out and was up and running in less than 5 minutes. The speed improvement was very noticeable. They have been running without a hitch for several months now and we have been pounding the network with 4K streaming, online gaming, and moving very large video files.
customer_reviews.author: Ztimster

customer_reviews.title: USED TO be great.
customer_reviews.text: I have a stack of the older version of this exact model. The form factor changes have really killed its usefulness. Most notably, they moved the power plug from the back with the ethernet jacks to the side of the device. This makes the effective widith LARGER than an 8 port switch. The prices are so similar, the ONLY reason I ever get the 5 port model is for the super tiny compact footprint...which is now null. Way to ruin a great product TRENDnet.
customer_reviews.author: Erich

customer_reviews.title: High pitched noise
customer_reviews.text: Perfect it does exactly what it says it’s supposed to do but I get it three starts because of a very high pitched noise , similar to another review . I would be open to replacement . Update : less than 24 hours later it had died getting a refund
customer_reviews.author: Kelly.M

customer_reviews.title: Reduces speed
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get constant speed above 100 mps on this switch. Every time I did a speed test I noticed the speed would drop. Changed out to a different brand and my speed was higher and stayed constant. Wish I would have realized this was the problem earlier, now outside of my return window. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home office
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my home office because the WiFi signal was weak and I need more Ethernet ports to connect with lap stops. This one is perfect for home office , small in size , metal body , stylish with LED indicators. It has 5 ports which is great for a home office
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Been using these for years
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying switches from TRENDnet for almost 20 years. I've never experienced a moment of trouble. This is the 3rd one of this model that I've purchased for expanding needs, not for replacement. The old ones just keep going. They are the Energizer bunny of switches.
customer_reviews.author: James L. Skidmore

customer_reviews.title: Recieved as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Received network switch as described. Used as my main switch from my Modem/Router to my streaming Apple TV, Plex and Roku boxes. One of the key features that sold me is the silent operation and no heat (casing not warm when in operation), and this product delivered on those two things. Another thing that attracted my attention is the low lever energy use, which I have no benchmark to prove otherwise but this selling point contributed in my purchase. I purchased not long ago, and if anything changes I'll update accordingly this review.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Work
customer_reviews.text: This Item Did Not Work at All. I purchased this and didn't use it right away, so I couldn't return it. When I did set it up the box got really hot and all lines dead it might as well have been a block of wood with 5 plug in ports and one for power plug, it would have been just as good. Trendnet 5-port peace of junk
customer_reviews.author: larry ridl

customer_reviews.title: Loving TRENDnet Switches
customer_reviews.text: This is my second TRENDnet switch. Upgraded to this one from an older 100Mbps switch after I increased my internet speeds. Haven't had any issues with internet or local speeds while downloading/transferring between multiple machines. Build Quality is great, no setup required, just plug and play. Planning on buying another switch with link aggregation for my NAS, will definitely consider another TRENDnet switch.
customer_reviews.author: Cortez

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: The item would not even register anything connected to it and there was a burning smell - Replacement requested from Amazon, so we will see what the replacement is like!
customer_reviews.author: Shane G

customer_reviews.title: Networking made easy.
customer_reviews.text: Came undamaged. Simple plug and connect. Plugged Modem in, connected my consoles and PC in, and it did the rest. No more sharing ethernet cords. Same speed distribute evenly throughout the network. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mauro

customer_reviews.title: Works great but DC port needs to be routed to the back of the Unit.
customer_reviews.text: Built well - metal housing, requires very low amount of power to run, works well and is reliable. If the DC connection for power wasn't on the side of the unit and was in the back with the ports I would have given this 5 stars, with the configuration the way it is, it's very inconvenient to have to route the power plug out of the way. Very big design flaw in my opinion as it makes no sense to have the power connection on the side of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: MaxedMac

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, Fast, and Cost Effective
customer_reviews.text: I work in tech, primarily with small businesses, and have had great luck with this line of TRENDnet switches. They are fast, reliable and very reasonably priced for the quality. I've used the unmanaged 5 and 8-port models, as well as the 16 and 24-port Web-Smart switches, and have had zero problems with any of them. Lower power consumption is also a bonus and they are very quiet and run relatively cool as well. I haven't had any major issues, so haven't ever tried to use TRENDnet support so I can't speak to that. Overall, these are efficient, cost-effective, reliable and well-designed devices. Definitely recommend any switches from this line.
customer_reviews.author: That One Lady

customer_reviews.title: Fast little switch!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this little switch for over 6 months now and it's never had to be restarted and has great speeds. It's connected to an Xbox One ,Xbox 360, Vizio TV, WDTVLIVE and the 5th port is connected NetGear Gigabit Router on the other side of the house. Games from the One and the 360 always show us at the highest level of connection. Transferring large file sizes are a breeze. 8GB over the network usually only takes a few minutes. Tip: It's a light weight switch so your cables may keep it from sitting where you want. Buy a command strip to help keep it in place.
customer_reviews.author: KeyMan

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play and pretty much idiot proof
customer_reviews.text: I had a 10/100 from the "blue" company. It worked but I now needed gigabit speeds and this fit the bill. Plug and play and pretty much idiot proof. Getting my rated speeds and no loss connectivity. One of my better buys this year. If I needed another there would be no hesitation to buy again or recommend. This has gone on sale a number of times and is an absolute beast at the few dollars they charge. Update: I have a 150/150 connection but can't hit 100mb on the upload. Getting the full 150 on DL but perplexed why the upload would only be 2/3 of my rated speed.
customer_reviews.author: SHANE D.

customer_reviews.title: Simple. Sturdy. Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as advertised. I'm using this behind my media wall to avoid running multiple ethernet cables to each piece in my entertainment center from my router. I have one cable going from my Netgear router into this switch, feeding 4 items with network connectivity. Pros: Metal housing is stronger than anticipated. Setup could not have been easier. Plug and Play. Con: The power adapter. Yet another wall wart that demands more space than it should ever need. Why not end with a small plug and have the "wall wart" somewhere in between the switch and the outlet? This is crucial for entertainment setups that already require so many power plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Josh B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Gigabit switch that is wall mountable!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a wall mountable gigabit switch to connect my laptop, desktop and xbox to my existing router. This fits the bill perfectly and I have seen no issues getting the full gigabit speeds between the devices!
customer_reviews.author: AlanB

customer_reviews.title: Budget-friendly 5 Port gigabit switch.
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it's supposed to do. Plug it in, add your ethernet connections, power on your router and it's good to go. Won't do vlans, but that's not why you buy it. Price is good.
customer_reviews.author: Doctorshadowmerchant

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for mesh systems
customer_reviews.text: Many mesh systems only have one external Ethernet port - a problem if your original router had several ports that were filled. This switch is plug-and-play, trouble-free and well-priced.
customer_reviews.author: CORe Specialists

customer_reviews.title: Compact, 5-Port G/Switch
customer_reviews.text: Very compact Gb unmanaged Green 5-port switch. Has 10 Gb switching backplane. Connected my FireTV Cube and Roku up to switch to consolidate wiring. Plug & Play. Easy and excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: jayr

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch Product at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: There's really nothing bad I can say about the GREENnet line of products. They perform very well, they're almost all built with sturdy metal housings (I have more than one), the price is very reasonable, and they consume so little power in operation it almost isn't measurable with my meter. It's also very small. It has ample provision for airflow, but I don't see any reason you'd ever need to worry about heat. Don't pay more for a switch than you have to (unless the other switch does something that this one does not). In my application, I estimated that this product should use about 1 kWh of electricity per month or less - about 10 cents in my area.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R.

customer_reviews.title: Great little switch
customer_reviews.text: I needed a switch for my office where the Wi-Fi singal just doesn't reach well. Plugged this guy in, connected the incoming network and then two desktop PCs close by and I was up and running in no time. I picked it up on sale for around $15 i think. Saw a similar one at Best Buy recently for $25 which made me really glad I picked this one up.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Byington

customer_reviews.title: Great price, Excellent Lifetime Support!
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use, very inexpensive price, and with Lifetime support, how could you go wrong with this TRENDnet unmanaged switch! Just plug it in, plug in your devices, and your good to go! When buying any switch, make sure you purchase one with more ports then you expect to use, as you will quickly find more devices you will need ports for :) TRENDnet gets a 5 Stars from me! Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Systopian Solutions, a Division of Eutopian Trader, LLC.

customer_reviews.title: Metal.  Great for your toolbox
customer_reviews.text: I keep these around for testing, and often they wind up just saving the day when a new connection is needed before the wiring guy can get by to run a new home run. Good quality metal case. Essential for my IT toolbox. Cheap enough to just leave if a customer needs one.
customer_reviews.author: armssDOTnet

customer_reviews.title: Nice little switch
customer_reviews.text: My needs were for a small Gigabit swtich with metal housing and low price for the conference room and this product met all of those needs, I plugged it in this morning and it worked so 5 stars. This thing was even smaller than I expected. The box says its V4.0R and I bought directly from Amazon if anyone is looking for this specific version. The difference between this version and the picture is that the power supply plugs in on the side rather than the back. This may be a problem for some configurations but it was fine for mine. I just bought another one for my office, great little switch, plug and play 1 minute setup
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Apple TV (my wife likes apple) and whatever other smart devices I get in the future rather than rely ...
customer_reviews.text: I decided to hard wire my PS4, Roku, Apple TV (my wife likes apple) and whatever other smart devices I get in the future rather than rely on WiFi for everything. I keep it set back on a shelf below my TV, slightly in view because I enjoy blinky lights. Don't enjoy them? Hide it behind the TV. I still use WiFi for phones, tablets and such but I think there's a benefit from not having everything share WiFi. Don't do wireless what you can do wired is pretty much my tech mantra, unless you can't hide the wires. :)
customer_reviews.author: seth albaum

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: It arrived quickly, was easy to set up, and worked like a charm. I use it to split my Ethernet line to my entertainment center between Dish Hopper, Smart TV, and other media boxes that I want to be directly wired rather than wireless to my router.
customer_reviews.author: Jim J

customer_reviews.title: Good little switch, but makes a slight buzz noise when running
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice little switch, I have it installed inside a telephony panel in the basement. However, while the case is metal, the inner RJ45 jacks are plastic, and the power plug is on the side which made for some strange positioning. It's been running for about a week with no problems but I've noticed this switch makes a slight electric buzz/vibration. Never had that before, and I've have several switches from different brands. I hope it's not a defect... time will tell I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Juan V.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have two computers at my desk that I never run at the same time. This was the perfect solution instead of running two cables to the other side of my house where the router/modem is.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Craig

customer_reviews.title: ... in my son's room to have Ethernet connections for better speed. He's got a gaming PC
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to allow several devices in my son's room to have Ethernet connections for better speed. He's got a gaming PC, a PS4 connected. It was as easy as plugging in cables, plugging it in, and everything worked. The version I received did have mounting holes, although I don't use them. Also supplied are little rubber dots to stick on the bottom and act as feet for resting the device on a desktop surface.
customer_reviews.author: TJM

customer_reviews.title: There isn't anything to not like about it, as long as you don't specifically need 'managed' functionality...
customer_reviews.text: I actually have a number of these in my home, and they all run perfectly. I really do like that they are power-efficient & will power down ports when not in use. The savings likely won't be dramatic, but when you're running a lot of ports, every bit helps. The cost really can't be beat either, so I can't think of too many reasons why you wouldn't go for a unit like this. Unless you're doing something that needs a managed unit, this will fulfill your needs nicely. Also, it runs cool...which is a factor compared to some other brands that I used to use!
customer_reviews.author: The Active Geek

customer_reviews.title: Kills speed.  Not true gb
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1GB connection that regularly speed tests between 750 and 990mb. Once this switch is put in place, the speeds are reduced to 130 to 250.
customer_reviews.author: Techoma

customer_reviews.title: Excellent switch!
customer_reviews.text: What an excellent product! Aesthetically speaking, this switch has a superior build featuring an all metal flat-black chassis. No flimsy plastic present! Definitely has a quality feel to it. As far as performance goes, this TRENDnet 5-port switch does exactly what it's supposed to do and it's simply plug-and-play. No configuration necessary whatsoever. I was able to get a few devices off our crowded Wifi cheaply and very effectively. I've had this switch for a few months now and even with very heavy use, I have not had to reset it yet. You just can't go wrong for $15. It's a steal at this price and just works.
customer_reviews.author: Mojoed

customer_reviews.title: Simple plug and play
customer_reviews.text: It did exactly what I needed it to do. Have the modem downstairs so I bought a cat 8 cable and hooked up this switch box and I’m getting the speeds I needed over Wi-Fi.
customer_reviews.author: MoK

customer_reviews.title: Smart little switch
customer_reviews.text: As a Mac user I appreciate plug and play hardware. I'm not a networking pro and I didn't need to be one to use this switch. Plugged it into my router and three computers and a NAS and everybody was happy. Though my router and gateway are not gigabit, my computers are, including my Mac Mini server. Communication between my iMac and the server is markedly faster, as is the throughput to the NAS from both of these machines. There even seems to be less latency between my computers and the Internet, even though one wouldn't think there would be. I definitely recommend this switch for its size and its smarts, as well as its performance improvements.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M. Walton

customer_reviews.title: Great switch great price
customer_reviews.text: What a great price for a gigabit ethernet switch. This thing is nice and compact and made very well, saves power when not in use / using shorter cables etc. Great concept, not sure if it really saves or not since its too small of a power consumer to notice. No speed loss that I can tell. The only con I have for this item is that the power cord that is included is awful short, kind of silly considering that making that a few feet longer wouldn't cost much. Overall though I am glad I selected this switch, I have 2 of them now and might be needing a 3rd for my office.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Neal

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, stays cool, needs mounting bracket or instructions
customer_reviews.text: No problems so far, and cool to the touch. I like the slick look. For what I paid I guess it deserves a perfect five. The two suggestions I have: one, be a little clearer in the online product descriptions about the power supply. This one has an external AC adapter as opposed to the model with an internal one (at nearly twice the price). I knew that when I ordered, but it took a while to find that detail on Amazon's pages. Two, and more importantly, the device has two slots on the bottom, obviously for mounting, but no screws or mount plate came with it, and the sparse instructions provide no recommendations.
customer_reviews.author: LC in NJ

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely simple to use
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect to have to do much to set this thing up and I had to do even less than that. Essentially all I had to do was plug it in, connect my computers and then the router and it did its thing all automatically for me. I can now access the computers on my network at 1Gbps while the rest of my network still has access to the wireless router. It takes up very little space and supposedly it uses less energy on the shorter cords. I will appreciate the savings on my electric bill since this thing will be running 24/7. It works great with Steam's In-home streaming.
customer_reviews.author: arleas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect combination of quality, ease-of-use, and price
customer_reviews.text: I needed a gigabit-capable switch at work so I could get more devices connected to our company networks. The TRENDnet TEG-S50g had all the features I was looking for: durable metal case, reasonable price, and excellent reviews commending its ease of installation and power efficiency. Installation was indeed quick and simple and my expanded in-office network was up and running in only a few minutes. The small size made it easy to tuck the switch out of sight. I'd definitely buy more of these for future use at work or at home, including the 8 port model that seems to have all the same outstanding attributes for only a few dollars more.
customer_reviews.author: David Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Energy Saving Gigabit switch
customer_reviews.text: Great 5 port Gigabit Ethernet switch. The switch is inexpensive but functions on par with more expensive brands. Plus this is uses considerably less energy than comparable switches. Would I buy again? Absolutely...YES.
customer_reviews.author: F. D. Krebs

customer_reviews.title: Happy with TrendNet
customer_reviews.text: I know I have only been using this Trendnet switcher for a short time, but it has been working flawlessly so far. I have read complaints about some other brands of switchers running hot and making noise. This Trendnet switch works silently and cool. I have it handling all the network traffic for two wireless access points, plus a heavily used computer, a printer, and shared network hard drive. I just wish I had gone for the 8 port version, since all the ports are currently in use. I will definitely stick with TrendNet when I upgrade. i also have a Trendnet router which I am very happy with.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey and John

customer_reviews.title: TRENDnet Gigabit Switch
customer_reviews.text: Simple to install, sturdy metal case (heavy enough that the attached cables don't move it around). Issues: 1. The power adapter takes up 2 outlets on my power strip, just barely covers the ground on adjacent outlet so a 2-prong plug would still work (seems to be a common problem with most power adapters). 2. My old switches had 5 ports + a dedicated uplink port, so I could connect 5 devices, this only allows 4 devices if your are uplinking since one of the five ports is used to uplink. I bought 2 units and they uplinked and function without issue. The LED's make it easy to see what's going on at a glance. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: Followed instructions (they're simple) and can't get any internet connection to anything connected to switch. I have working internet going to the switch, but nothing coming out of any other port.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Well built.
customer_reviews.text: Very solid. I've used this brand a couple times now for myself and customer installs including POE switches. Got one POE running in a hot garage powering 10 cameras and no issues after a year. This switch is great as well.
customer_reviews.author: TCGF F.

customer_reviews.title: Thus far a solid product
customer_reviews.text: I installed this switch / hub for my Son's bedroom, so his laptop, game console, HDTV, etc all have the Internet and local access they require. The entire network is entirely Gigabit. Thus far it has been running like a champ in stability and performance and resides at the end of a series of other switches (48 port, 8 port and an 100 foot cable and 50 foot cable). It clearly is faster than a 10/100 hub-switch and it has been stable (in the 3 days or so we've been using it). Honestly, not much one can say about an unmanaged switch, as it works or doesn't work. This one is working and doing its job well.
customer_reviews.author: Bert in Chicago who is a happy and loyal Amazon Customer. :-)

customer_reviews.title: worked fine for... 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: 2 stars for the 2 years of functional service. Sometime after ~2 years, all ports went dead - unit powers up fine. I've tested both sides of the connections, cables, and all ports separately.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Quality build, plug it in and it works.
customer_reviews.text: Well this is an excellent switch. Plugged it in worked right away zero issues. Its super tiny and feels nice quality still a heavier metal feel, its not heavy by any means it's tiny, just feels well built. I don't know what more you could ask for in an unmanaged switch to be honest.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Weathers

customer_reviews.title: is a sweet spot. None I have bought have faltered but ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the quintessential home switches. I have bought many of these. When I need a switch for heavy work but small footprint, I will scour the web for these Trendnet Greennet devices and the price, when you can find them on sale, is a sweet spot. None I have bought have faltered but if you stack them, keep about an inch of space between them, which the small rubber legs are not enough for, otherwise you eventually start getting errors. Simple fix. The metal housing is also a neat heat dissipating and sturdy feature that sets it apart from the others in its class. Brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: Justchaz

customer_reviews.title: Fit my use case perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Finally upgraded my TV to a "smart" flat screen and my DVD player to a modern Blu-Ray. Had a TiVo in the existing setup using wired Ethernet and knew I could use something to allow easily connecting the new devices. This affordable and apparently solidly built unit has worked flawlessly to enable the existing single Ethernet outlet to service the "smart" TV, the DVD, the Fire TV, and the TiVo. Yes, wireless could have worked ... but this has so far proved very reliable and made for a much simpler installation and configuration.
customer_reviews.author: Sam B.

customer_reviews.title: Works great to interface my home network devices at Gigabit speeds
customer_reviews.text: Works great to interface my home network devices at Gigabit speeds. My cable modem doesn't need a Gigabit connection, but I can now connect my computers to my NAS devices at Gig speeds and not the 100M speeds. Makes a HUGE difference in data backup speed. This little box is working great. Just plug it in, connect Ethernet cables, and it's purring along just fine. I'm a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Cool

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, it simply works.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, it simply works. UPDATE: Still working. I have bought a couple of these. They are great if you have one CAT5 outlet on the wall, but have multiple devices that need a hard-wired network connection. Plug a patch cable from the wall to this device, and use the other ports for your devices. Really simple, and a great cheap fix.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Loodis

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up with instant connectivity
customer_reviews.text: 5 years ago I bought one that was an 8-port and it's been working great. I decided to try and use this 5-port model to share the Ethernet connection going to my cable box. Unfortunately it didn't work ☹️
customer_reviews.author: InquisitiveGuy

customer_reviews.title: Very good for college student
customer_reviews.text: I'm a college student and on my desk I have a laptop, printer, and Xbox. The WiFi at my school is awful, so I wanted a way to connect all my devices to the network, but I was limited to one Ethernet port in the wall (2 per room, but my roommate was using his). I wanted a cheep way to get all my devices connected (with cat 6), and this is exactly what I was looking for. The metal case is very sturdy-looking, and when paired with 4 Monoprice cables (1 for each device and one to connect to the school network) the total cost was just over $30.
customer_reviews.author: Keegan

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong with TRENDnet. Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: TRENDnet makes a very good product for the price. Solid construction, reliable, etc. I have several ethernet switches and wifi extenders.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent switch
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these switches based on reviews as I needed small gig switches and they were much smaller than the ones in my local store. These boxes are alway on since the day I purchased. Never tested if it gives me the full 1 gig but this is used for home network that is using lots of streaming and I never had any problem. As one of them is placed in a communication closet i wanted a switch that i will not need to reboot every week cause the closet is not the most accessible closet in the world. never had to reboot them, not even once. as mentioned, on from the day they were connected. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mr B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Years Old - Still Going Strong
customer_reviews.text: I'm reviewing the 5 port TRENDnet TEG-S50g which I purchased almost exactly five years ago. The items it switches between are a mix of 1Gbps and 100Mbps and I've had no issues at all. In fact I haven't given it a thought since I first plugged it in - That is until today when I stumbled over the instructions. Few people do reviews this long after the fact so I thought I'd post this short comment praising the unit's longevity.
customer_reviews.author: R. Stoer

customer_reviews.title: Great little switch!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this switch over the NetGear ProSafe after a good bit of research. Either switch will perform beautifully, but the TRENDnet has the ports on the rear of the unit. My mounting would look terrible with wires protruding from the FRONT of the unit. Some are complaining that the lights seem *on* when viewed from a dramatic angle...well don't look at it from the side! This switch performs great and is literally a tiny little metal box (with sticky rubber feet you put on yourself). I bought (2) for now...and will buy more if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D. Faulk

customer_reviews.title: Good Small Gigabit Switch
customer_reviews.text: Bought this switch to up the transfer speed of data across my network and it serves its purpose without question. It is a lot smaller than the photos would have you believe, and the case is made out of metal finished in dark green. It barely heats up and is doing its best with my Cat5 cable.(will upgrade to Cat5e or Cat6 when i get the chance and will update if speeds have improved) Have noticed that the green LEDs in the network jacks on my motherboards have been turned off and there is now orange and amber lights instead, when connected to the switch. Thanks TRENDnet for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Low quality feel, annoying noise.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to have a hub closer to my computer, so I can hook up devices as needed when testing different things. I didn't like the quality (just din't feel high quality), and whenever I had connections in it, it emitted this higher frequency sound (even with a replacement device) that could be heard when ear level with it. In a media room/den, this is unbearable.
customer_reviews.author: John Dembeck

customer_reviews.title: Works superbly
customer_reviews.text: I have used these over the years. They are inexpensive and do the job, with reasonable throughput.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Kolibal

customer_reviews.title: Great switch
customer_reviews.text: Works great no issues I never had any issues with switches unless you have power surge which I recently had and one of my switches went bad but usually i get a lifetime warranty ones so that always works out
customer_reviews.author: Junaid

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great, have my ps4, pc, and tv plugged into it. Never notice any drop in anything and the download is fine for me
customer_reviews.author: Jmoe89

customer_reviews.title: ... it for a couple days but so far so good. Was plug and play
customer_reviews.text: I've only had it for a couple days but so far so good. Was plug and play. I lost a little bit of download and upload speed but didn't have any packet loss or increased latency so I'm fine with it. The compact size is nice also. I use it to hard wire my game systems so I can't comment on the going to sleep issues others have had with it. All in all, it was cheap and it works.
customer_reviews.author: Lee D

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend, expensively over other brands.
customer_reviews.text: My only other experience is with a TP-Link router that I recently threw away. I had a whole TP-Link setup, router, wireless access point, switch that never worked well. Since I could not figure out which TP-Link product was at fault I dumped all 3. I use this so I can hook up my wireless access point and PC from the same wall port. I consistently get speeds above 125 Mbit with my gigibit router via comcast. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Review dude

customer_reviews.title: Great little inexpensive non-managed switch
customer_reviews.text: Solidly built metal enclosure, includes 4 small rubber feet. These inexpensive switches do a great job and I have zero complaints, other than the bizarre decision to have the AC adapter plug into the *side* of the unit rather than the rear. This makes it slightly more messy when placing it on a shelf with other devices, but it's a minor complaint. The switch itself works perfectly and I have never had one go bad on me after continuous use.
customer_reviews.author: Ken H.

customer_reviews.title: Little box of wonders!
customer_reviews.text: Econimic but reliable unmanaged gigabit switch. If you want portability or just need to connect a few devices, this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: J. Castellanos

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended, basic (dumb) 4-port + uplink 1Gbps port switch.
customer_reviews.text: This little switch is great. Highly versatile and easy to use, just plug and play. I had 4 PCs connected pulling updates at the same time and this switch just kept on keeping on. Excellent for the price, heck excellent for a switch costing twice or more. Through it in a little nylon mesh bag for easy transport and carry. Really comes in handy when you need some extra ports temporarily and when you're building out a small test lab or something.
customer_reviews.author: EricTop Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Truly amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I have been frustrated with slow copy speeds from PC to PC. With a normal switch (100 mbps) maximum speed is 10 megabytes per second. Now I am running as high as 75-80 megabytes per second! That is a 7 or 8 time improvement. Now it's like all hard drives, anywhere on my network run at the same speed as if the hard drive was inside the local machine! [...]. Of course each machine must have a gigabyte network connection. Just about all motherboards made in the last year have one. I am using standard cables and they work just fine. However, my longest cable is 6 feet.
customer_reviews.author: MR CPA

customer_reviews.title: Great switch that passes VLAN information
customer_reviews.text: Great switch that works as expected. One important note is that while this is an unmannaged switch, it DOES pass VLAN tags (it can't manage those tags or apply tags like a managed switch). So if you have something on the other end that tags traffic with VLAN IDs, unlike other unmannaged switches, this switch will actually pass the tag information to the router. I use it with my Ubiquity UniFi AP, which tags traffic, and it passes the traffic to my router for management.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, small form factor, works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these. One over a year ago and then another just recently. Based on my experience, this switch works great and they last. I am using one to supply an internet connection to my TV, DVR and DVD player. The other is feeding a computer and a printer. It gets a little warm but nothing of concern. You get some feedback from lights on the front if you want. Mine are both behind furniture. If you need a small switch, this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas ParkerTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Fast Ethernet
customer_reviews.text: The ethernet 10/100/1000 is fast. For the consumer, make sure your equipment can receive the faster speed and subscribed speed with more than 200mps (236mps with Spectrum) from your internet provider.
customer_reviews.author: Mary S

customer_reviews.title: Great value basic switch
customer_reviews.text: Great basic switch. Wish the power plug wasn’t in the side as it’s hard to hide the cable or for in a tight space.
customer_reviews.author: Song Huang

customer_reviews.title: Excellent switch
customer_reviews.text: This switch was very good. There is very little bandwidth drop between router and the switch, as a result the PC get the nearly full bandwidth from the ISP.
customer_reviews.author: AK2011

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended, it is an unmanaged switch and works as one should, no issues
customer_reviews.author: Chewy

customer_reviews.title: sturdy case, it works, hard to find faults with it
customer_reviews.text: perfectly serviceable network switch where one needs extra LAN hookups. There are more sophisticated uses for these things but I just needed it to "split" one LAN connection to two to connect both my receiver and PC. Both receiver and PC have been network accessible with no noticeable lag or delays in network speed so there's not much to say about performance in that area other than that it works.
customer_reviews.author: BuyItOnce

customer_reviews.title: Works mint. Zero maintenance
customer_reviews.text: Works mint. Installed in a basement and have never had to touch it since. Getting a second one for a friends house.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great unmanaged switch.  Great Price.
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive switch. If you are going to be hooking up a couple of devices in your home this will do the trick. Great price, great quality. Not top of the line, but do you really need that for home installations? I am an IT Director and find that this unit works perfectly in my home. I would even consider it for a small office, but buy managed switches for use in midsize offices. This switch has it's place.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: I thought we left that problem behind like 15 years ago
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these devices and tried to connect them together. Turns out that they don't have MDIX for auto-crossover detection. So you have to go ol' school and use a crossover cable. I thought we left that problem behind like 15 years ago... Good solid device otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: daveml

customer_reviews.title: No problems, seems well made...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly and was very inexpensive. This switch is on 24/7 and has never needed to be touched since the day I installed it. I can't tell any difference with this or plugging in directly. If you need a switch give this one a try... I like mine a lot. Cord is very short, maybe 3' and it has a transformer in the plug end, so it is bigger than a standard lamp style end, so be aware of that when considering where you will plug it in.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Albert

customer_reviews.title: Easy network expasion and it is seamless.
customer_reviews.text: I have two now and these are a seamless integration to my internet and home networking. I believe that these pass data better than trying to get wireless to all the rooms with strong signal. If you have a home that is networked and you have lets say xbox, PS, computer, video streamer all in one spot; just buy this and plug them into the Ethernet plug that is in the room. Theses are awesome and work great.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: very reliable
customer_reviews.text: I've got five of these in my home network bought one at a time. I've used them for several years with no problem. As with any Windows network, you occasionally have to restart things but generally they have been very reliable and you can't necessarily blame problems on the switch. I like TRENDnet products and have other TRENDnet products.
customer_reviews.author: tech232

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and improved throughput over older switch.
customer_reviews.text: Truly plug and play install. Is smaller than my old switch, but heavier so it sits more securely on my shelf with all 5 ports in use. My bandwidth on devices connected to the new switch is nearly double the bandwidth I was achieving on my old 10/100 linksys. No hesitation to recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Burton

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: I got this because my verizon fios router is only 100mb/s and coping big files between machines was taking to long. This makes a nice difference. I am not sure if it the type of files I am copying (RAR, ZIP) but I am averaging about 21mb/s. Other times I am getting 60-70mb/s. When using my fios router I get about 6-9mb/s so more then double the speed. The device itself is very small and takes up no room. Nothing to setup, just plug it in and your set. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: dstein

customer_reviews.title: Good networking appliance
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a big fan of wifi, so I prefer to hard wire when possible. I use this to split the signal from my AT&T Uverse modem, giving me enough ports to power my home entertainment system and run wires to other parts of my house. I have a second unit in my office that gets its stream from the first unit attached to my modem. Very dependable, works with no set-up, and the auto-switching is a nice feature that kept me from doing extra work when I ran the Cat 5e cables.
customer_reviews.author: Alex G

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and Uses Only a Little Electricity.
customer_reviews.text: I use it all the time and no problems. I bought it because of its lower power consumption and the fact that it was gigabit. It runs all the time, so power consumption is important. These things last a long time and as things move toward gigabit connections, you are already prepared.
customer_reviews.author: S Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Best value for a gigabit hub/switch
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised with one unexpected characteristic - with a 10 or 100 Mbit/sec. connection the port link detect light is off, with a 1000 Mbit/sec connection it's on. Most 10/100/1000 hubs have a 2 color indicator, one color for 10/100, a different one for 1000Mbs. The purpose for the link detect light is to indicate that you have a good end-to-end connection. With this hub if you are connected to a 10/100Mbs device you don't know if the connection is good until you actually communicate over that port.
customer_reviews.author: CalifDiver

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I'm holding my breath because it's been my experience these switches aren't reliable for very long so I try to avoid using them. However now because of the elaborate wired network I've built at home I need these kinds of devices. I'm happy to say this switch is everything advertised and 2 months in service without a hiccup. I bought it on the strength of the brand name alone. I haven't been disappointed. If it continues to function like it has I'll improve my rating to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin Barfield

product_meta.title: TRENDnet 5-Port Unmanaged Gigabit GREENnet Desktop Metal Switch, TEG-S50g, Ethernet Splitter, Ethernet/Network Switch, 5 x Gigabit Ports, Fanless, 10 Gbps Switching Fabric, Lifetime Protection,Black
product_meta.description:
Capacity:5-Port Gigabit| Model:UnmanagedThe 5-Port Gigabit GREENnet Switch model TEG-S50g provides high bandwidth performance ease of use and reliability all while reducing power consumption by up to 70%* GREENnet technology automatically adjusts power consumption as needed resulting in substantial energy savings Embedded GREENnet technology works right out of the box with no management requirement Boost office network efficiency and eliminate network congestion with gigabit speeds and a total switching capacity of 10Gbps with full-duplex mode Integrate this sturdy metal switch for reliable high speed network connectivity Energy SavingsEmbedded GREENnet technology provides cost savings and reduces power consumption by up to 70% by limiting port power consumption during periods of low link utilization Gigabit Speeds5 gigabit ports provide high-speed network connections to devices and a 10Gbps switching capacity allows data traffic to flow smoothly reducing traffic bottleneckspact DesignWith a compact and lightweight metal housing design this switch is well-suited for desktop installations Its fanless design is perfect for quiet environments that require silent operation PACKAGE CONTENTSTEG-S50gQuick Installation GuidePower adapter (5V DC 1A)

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
TRENDnet
